DataElement.preferredName: Patient Alkylating Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether a patient received alkylating agents that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Alkylating Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Agents that replace hydrogen atom(s) in biologically active molecules with alky radical(s), hindering proper function.  Alkylating agents exhibit cytotoxic effects through the alkylation of DNA, resulting in strand cross-linking, ultimately inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Alkylating Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Agents that replace hydrogen atom(s) in biologically active molecules with alky radical(s), hindering proper function.  Alkylating agents exhibit cytotoxic effects through the alkylation of DNA, resulting in strand cross-linking, ultimately inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Agents that replace hydrogen atom(s) in biologically active molecules with alky radical(s), hindering proper function.  Alkylating agents exhibit cytotoxic effects through the alkylation of DNA, resulting in strand cross-linking, ultimately inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was last dose of alkylating a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of alkylating agents at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment and at least 3 weeks from other cytotoxic chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of alkylating agents at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment and last dose of other cytotoxic chemotherapy was at least 3 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of temozolomide at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment and last dose of other cytotoxic chemothertrapy was at least 3 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with alkylators (e.g., melphalan, cyclophosphamide) and anthracyclines less than or equal to 14 days prior to registration?
